title: New Zealand coach Steve Hansen calls Eddie Jones' spy claims 'clickbait' as he names team to tackle England
text:
All Blacks head coach, Steve Hansen, dismissed Eddie Jones’ pointed remarks about England’s training having been filmed as a diversionary tactic to take pressure off his own team ahead of their World Cup semi-final, adding that the two coaches had had ‘a bit of a giggle,’ about it all in text exchanges.

Hansen also stressed that it is England who are feeling acute pressure after messing up so badly four years ago when they became the first hosts to ever exit a World Cup at the pool stage.

“Eddie and I both know that all is fair in love and war,” said Hansen as he announced a team with one surprise, the inclusion of second-row line out forward, Scott Barrett, on the flank.
